What is BYO in restaurants?
Bring Your Own alcohol, some restaurants allow this, but they will charge cockage fee
What is super?
superannuation, a retirement saving system where employers are required to make contribution to at 10% of your total earning
What is annual leave?
paid leave for full-time workers, at 20 days per year.
Why do casual workers not get annual leave?
because they get paid a higher casual rate instead
What is 'slip, slop, slap'?
sun safety slogan, slip on a shirt, slop on sunscreen, slap on a hat
Can you turn left on a red light?
Not in Australia, but legal in other countries to make small turn on red light
What is a 'hook turn'?
A right turn from the left lane, exists exclusively in Melbourne CBD
Which way does the clock move in summer daylight saving by an hour?
forward
Does daylight saving apply to all of Australia?
Not the tropical northern half, (i.e., QLD, NT, WA)
What is the most widely spoken language in the world?
Mandarin as native language, English if combining both native and second language
What is the normal human body temperature in Celsius?
around 37 degrees
Convert ratio: foot (US) to inch (US), inch to cm
1 foot : 12 inch, 1 inch = 2.54cm
Convert ratio: pound (US) to ounce(US), pound to KG, ounce to gram
1 lb = 16 oz, 1b = 0.45KG, 1oz = 28grams
What are two main causes that contribute to decreased value in a currency? ie, paying more for same things
inflation, and weak currency compared to other countries
What is inflation?
When prices rise over time for the same item/service, either due to weakening economy or more money being printed
What is the difference between unleaded, leaded, diesel petrol?
unleaded: standard, clean, civilian vehicles / leaded: toxic, phasing out / diesel: efficient, powerful, commercial or heavy vehicles
What happens if you add wrong petrol to your vehicle?
It will damage the engine
Is it safe to drive a car through water?
If it is lower than the bottom of your vehicle chassis, otherwise water can destroy the engine
What is gross income?
income before taxes, though you might claim some taxes back later
What is a variable interest rate?
The rate of interest one pays to the bank for mortgage borrowings, which changes with market rates, instead of being fixed as agreed upon.
What is browser cache?
Temporary storage for faster website loading, contains your history
What does RSVP mean?
French for 'Please Respond'
Is direct eye contact always polite?
Only in Western culture, not in the east. Self-importance vs Humility
What is bigotry?
All forms of prejudices against other groups of people.
Give me 3 forms of common bigotry
racism / homophobia / Islamophobia / anti-semitism / xenophobia / sexism / Sinophobia
Is it okay to discuss salary openly?
It is considered a private matter, so mostly a rude, or insensitive thing to do.
What is a visa?
Official permission to enter a country, though some countries offer visa-free access to certain countries.
What is Duty-Free?
Offering goods without local taxes, usually before one departs the country
What is a hostel?
Budget accomodation with shared rooms, targeting at young people.
Is having a strong currency always good?
Not necessarily, it depends on how much you are paid/spent in that currency, and it often discourages other countries from buying/spending.
